rejectionReasons.detail: The PR lacks necessary tests or has insufficient test coverage.
The changes raise concerns regarding code quality.
The PR introduces bugs or breaks existing functionality.
The proposed changes do not align with the project's design principles.
The changes result in a degradation of performance.
The PR introduces or does not adequately address security vulnerabilities.
Necessary documentation updates are missing or incomplete.
The changes are beyond the current project scope or goals.
The PR does not comply with the project's coding standards.
The PR introduces compatibility issues, licensing conflicts, or security risks with dependencies.
The PR proposes changes or additions that are already implemented, supported, or otherwise rendered unnecessary.
